CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Topics.​Topic
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Topics.​Topic

A class encapsulating all the information available about a topic.

Types
DatabaseCompareResult
public enum DatabaseCompareResult : byte

The result of two Topics being compared with DatabaseCompare().

Same

The topics are exactly the same.

Different

The topics are different in substantial ways.

Similar_WontAffectLinking

The topics differ in some fields, but in such a way as to not affect linking if one were substituted for another.

ChangeFlags
[Flags]
public enum ChangeFlags : uint

A bitfield that represents all the properties that were changed.  Note that this only applies when DatabaseCompareResult.Similar_WontAffectLinking is returned.  However, to prevent coding mistakes, all fields will be set to true when DatabaseCompareResult.Different is returned.

IgnoreFields
[Flags]
public enum IgnoreFields : uint

When querying topics from the database, not all fields may be needed in all circumstances.  This is a bitfield that allows you to specify which fields can be ignored.  This is also stored in the object so that, in debug builds, if you try to access any of these fields an exception will be thrown.

BuildFlags
[Flags]
public enum BuildFlags : byte

Flags that store which build-on-demand fields have aready been generated.

Functions
Topic
public Topic (
CommentTypes.Manager manager
)
Duplicate
public Topic Duplicate ()
DatabaseCompare
public DatabaseCompareResult DatabaseCompare (
Topic other,
out ChangeFlags changeFlags
)

Compares two topics, returning whether they are the same, different, or similar enough that one can be substituted for the other without affecting linking.  Similar allows use of CodeDB.Accessor.UpdateTopic().

If it returns DatabaseCompareResult.Similar_WontAffectLinking, changeFlags will also be set noting which specific fields have changed.  This isn't done with DatabaseCompareResult.Different, but all the flags will be set to true anyway to prevent errors.

TopicID, ClassID, PrototypeContextID, and BodyContextID are not included in the comparison because it's assumed that you would be comparing Topics from a parse, where they would not be set, to Topics from the database, where they would.  Temporary Properties are also not compared because they do not correspond to database fields.

AddTagID
public void AddTagID (
int tagID
)

Adds an individual tag ID to TagIDs.

AddTagsFrom
public void AddTagsFrom (
Topic other
)

Adds all the tags in the other Topic to this one.

HasTagID
public bool HasTagID (
int tagID
)

Whether TagIDs contains an individual tag ID.

ToString
override public string ToString ()

This is only available to aid debugging in Visual Studio.  When you have a list of objects it puts the result of ToString() next to each one.  You should not rely on it for anything else.

Database Properties

These properties map directly to database fields with minimal processing.

TopicID
public int TopicID { get; set }

The topic's ID number, or zero if it hasn't been set.

Title
public string Title { get; set }

The title of the topic, or null if it hasn't been set.

Body
public string Body { get; set }

The body of the topic's comment in <NDMarkup>, or null if it hasn't been set.

BodyLength
public int BodyLength { get; set }

The length of the topic's body.  If Body is set this is the equivalent of checking its Length property.  However, if <IgnoreField.Body> is on you can use this to still have its length retrieved from the database.

Summary
public string Summary { get; set }

The summary of the topic's comment in <NDMarkup>, or null if it hasn't been set.

Prototype
public string Prototype { get; set }

The plain text prototype of the topic, or null if it doesn't exist.

Symbol
public SymbolString Symbol { get; set }

The fully resolved symbol of the topic, or null if it hasn't been set.

SymbolDefinitionNumber
public int SymbolDefinitionNumber { get; set }

Every unique Symbol defined in a file is given a number, the first one being one.  Every duplicate definition of the same symbol will receive an incremented number based on the source file order.  This will be zero if it hasn't been determined yet.

ClassString
public ClassString ClassString { get; set }

The ClassString that this topic defines or is a part of.

ClassID
public int ClassID { get; set }

The ID of ClassString, or zero if ClassString is null or its ID is unknown.

ClassIDKnown
public bool ClassIDKnown { get }

Whether ClassID is known, which basically tests whether ClassID is zero when ClassString is not null.

IsList
public bool IsList { get; set }

Whether this is a list topic used to document multiple elements.  This will not be set for enums, though it would be set for a list of enums.

IsEmbedded
public bool IsEmbedded { get; set }

Whether this topic is embedded in a prior topic.  This is used for members of list and enum topics.  Entries that appear in definition lists within these topics will get their own Topic objects to allow for linking, but they will not appear in the output because they are already covered by the parent.  Embedded topics will always come after their parent in a list of topics, so the last non-embedded topic is the parent.

commentTypeID

The ID of the topic's comment type, or zero if it hasn't been set.

CommentTypeID
public int CommentTypeID { get; set }
DeclaredAccessLevel
public Languages.AccessLevel DeclaredAccessLevel { get; set }

The declared access level of the topic, or Languages.AccessLevel.Unknown if it isn't known or hasn't been set.  For a public member of an internal class, this would be public.

EffectiveAccessLevel
public Languages.AccessLevel EffectiveAccessLevel { get; set }

The effective access level of the topic, or Languages.AccessLevel.Unknown if it isn't known or hasn't been set.  For a public member of an internal class, this would be internal.

TagIDs
public IDObjects.NumberSet TagIDs { get }

An IDObjects.NumberSet containing all the tag IDs applied to this topic, or null if none.

TagString
public string TagString { get; set }

A string representation of an IDObjects.NumberSet containing all the tag IDs applied to this topic, or null if there are no tags applied or it hasn't been set.

FileID
public int FileID { get; set }

The ID number of the source file this topic appears in, or zero if it hasn't been set.

FilePosition
public int FilePosition { get; set }

The relative position of the topic in the file, or zero if it hasn't been set yet.  The first topic will be one, and every subsequent one will have a higher number.  This is done because not every topic will have a CommentLineNumber or a CodeLineNumber so the file order may not be determinable from them.

CommentLineNumber
public int CommentLineNumber { get; set }

The line number the topic's comment begins on, or zero if it hasn't been set yet or the topic doesn't have a comment.

CodeLineNumber
public int CodeLineNumber { get; set }

The line number the topic's code element begins on, or zero if it hasn't been set yet or the topic doesn't have a code element.

LanguageID
public int LanguageID { get; set }

The ID number of the language of this topic, or zero if it hasn't been set.

PrototypeContext
public ContextString PrototypeContext { get; set }

The ContextString that all prototype links should use.

PrototypeContextID
public int PrototypeContextID { get; set }

The ID of PrototypeContext, or zero if PrototypeContext is null or its ID is unknown.

PrototypeContextIDKnown
public bool PrototypeContextIDKnown { get }

Whether PrototypeContextID is known, which basically tests whether PrototypeContextID is zero when PrototypeContext is not null.

BodyContext
public ContextString BodyContext { get; set }

The ContextString that all body links should use.

BodyContextID
public int BodyContextID { get; set }

The ID of BodyContext, or zero if BodyContext is null or its ID is unknown.

BodyContextIDKnown
public bool BodyContextIDKnown { get }

Whether BodyContextID is known, which basically tests whether BodyContextID is zero when BodyContext is not null.

Temporary Properties

These properties aid in processing but are not stored in the database.

CommentTypes
public CommentTypes.Manager CommentTypes { get }

The CommentTypes.Manager associated with this topic.

EngineInstance
public Engine.Instance EngineInstance { get }

The Engine.Instance associated with this topic.

IgnoredFields
public IgnoreFields IgnoredFields { get; set }

When querying topics from the database, not all fields may be needed in all situations.  The database may accept IgnoreFields flags to skip retrieving parts of them.  If that's done, the flags should also be set here so that in debug builds an exception will be thrown if you try to access those properties.

IgnoredFields defaults to <IgnoreFields.None> so that topics created by parsing don't have to worry about them.

ParsedPrototype
public ParsedPrototype ParsedPrototype { get }

If Prototype is not null, this will be it in ParsedPrototype form.

ParsedClassPrototype
public ParsedClassPrototype ParsedClassPrototype { get }

If Prototype is not null and the comment type is part of the class hierarchy, this will be the prototype in ParsedClassPrototype form.

HasTitleParameters
public bool HasTitleParameters { get }

Whether there are any parameters in the title.  Unlike testing TitleParameters against null, this also distinguishes between titles with empty parentheses and titles with none.

TitleParameters
public ParameterString TitleParameters { get }

The parameters found in the title, as opposed to the prototype, or null if none.

PrototypeParameters
public ParameterString PrototypeParameters { get }

The parameters found in the prototype, or null if none.

IsEnum
public bool IsEnum { get }

Whether this topic uses a comment type that has the Enum flag set.  If CommentTypeID isn't set this will be false.

IsGroup
public bool IsGroup { get }

Whether this topic is a group topic.  If CommentTypeID isn't set this will be false.

DefinesClass
public bool DefinesClass { get }

Whether this topic defines its ClassString as opposed to just being a member.

Variables
manager

The CommentTypes.Manager associated with this topic.

commentTypes
protected CommentTypes.Manager commentTypes
topicID
protected int topicID

The topic's ID number, or zero if not specified.

title
protected string title

The title of the comment, or null if not specified.

body
protected string body

The body of the comment, or null if not specified.

bodyLength
protected int bodyLength

The length of body.  This is a separate field because it may be desirable to just have the length of the body without actually retrieving the body from the database.

summary
protected string summary

The summary of the comment, or null if not specified.

prototype
protected string prototype

The plain-text prototype of the topic, or null if not present.

parsedPrototype
protected ParsedPrototype parsedPrototype

The prototype in ParsedPrototype form, or null if prototype is null or it hasn't been generated yet.

parsedClassPrototype
protected ParsedClassPrototype parsedClassPrototype

The prototype in ParsedClassPrototype form, or null if prototype is null, it hasn't been generated yet, or this isn't appropriate for the comment type.

symbol
protected SymbolString symbol

The topic's fully resolved symbol, or null if not specified.

symbolDefinitionNumber
protected int symbolDefinitionNumber

Every unique symbol defined in a file is given a number, the first one being one.  Every duplicate definition of the same symbol will receive an incremented number based on the source file order.  This will be zero if it hasn't been determined yet.

classString
protected ClassString classString

The ClassString this topic defines or is a part of.

classID
protected int classID

The ID of classString, or zero if it's null or its ID is unknown.

isList
protected bool isList

Whether this is a list topic used to document multiple items.  This will not be set for enums, though it would be set for a list of enums.

isEmbedded
protected bool isEmbedded

Whether this topic is embedded in a prior topic.  This is used for entries in lists and enums.  Entries that appear in definition lists within these topics will get their own Topic objects to allow for linking, but they will not appear in the output because they are already covered by the parent.  Embedded topics will always come after their parent in a list of topics, so the last non-embedded topic is the parent.

titleParameters
protected ParameterString titleParameters

Any parameters found in the title, as opposed to the prototype.

prototypeParameters
protected ParameterString prototypeParameters

Any parameters found in the prototype.

commentTypeID
protected int commentTypeID

The ID number of the comment's type, or zero if not specified.

declaredAccessLevel
protected Languages.AccessLevel declaredAccessLevel

The declared access level of the topic.  For a public member of an internal class, this would be public.

effectiveAccessLevel
protected Languages.AccessLevel effectiveAccessLevel

The effective access level of the topic.  For a public member of an internal class, this would be internal.

tagIDs
protected IDObjects.NumberSet tagIDs

A set of the tags applied to this topic.  May or may not be null if there are none.

fileID
protected int fileID

The ID of the source file this topic appears in, or zero if not specified.

filePosition
protected int filePosition

The relative position of the topic in the file, or zero if not specified.  One will be the first topic and subsequent topics will have higher numbers.  This is done because the final position may not be determinable from commentLineNumber and codeLineNumber.

commentLineNumber
protected int commentLineNumber

The line number the comment appears on, or zero if not specified or the topic doesn't have one.

codeLineNumber
protected int codeLineNumber

The line number the actual code element appears on, or zero if not specified or the topic doesn't have one.

languageID
protected int languageID

The ID of the topic's language, or zero if not specified.

prototypeContext
protected ContextString prototypeContext

The ContextString that all prototype links should use.

prototypeContextID
protected int prototypeContextID

The ID of prototypeContext, or zero if it's null or its ID is unknown.

bodyContext
protected ContextString bodyContext

The ContextString that all body links should use.

bodyContextID
protected int bodyContextID

The ID of bodyContext, or zero if it's null or its ID is unknown.

ignoredFields
protected IgnoreFields ignoredFields

The IgnoreFields applied to this object.

buildFlags
protected BuildFlags buildFlags

Which build-on-demand fields have been generated.
